intro: Navarretia hamata subsp. hamata, commonly known as the hooked navarretia, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its small, white, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in coastal scrub habitats. It has linear, glabrous leaves and produces capsules as its fruiting structure. Navarretia hamata subsp. hamata is known for its delicate appearance and is often used in native plant gardens.
